entry.gloss: allow or enable to escape from confinement; set free.
entry.example: the government announced that the prisoners would be released

entry.gloss: allow (something) to move, act, or flow freely.
entry.example: she released his arm and pushed him aside
no details about the contents of the talks were released
Mr. Libenstein further argues that if he is found personally liable, the liability was released by his discharge from bankruptcy.

entry.gloss: a radio or television program or transmission.
entry.example: Seychellois radio and television broadcasts offer programs in Creole, English, and French.

entry.gloss: transmit (a program or some information) by radio or television.
scatter (seeds) by hand or machine rather than placing in drills or rows.
entry.example: Seed is broadcast or drilled on the pastures in late winter or early spring.

entry.gloss: of or relating to radio or television transmission.

entry.example: green manure can be sown broadcast or in rows
